definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Passengers must check in at the airport one hour before plane leaves.
sentences.chinese: 乘客必须在飞机起飞前一小时到机场签票。

sentences.english: Webcast of the take-off and landing will go live 5 minutes prior to each event.
sentences.chinese: 网上直播的起飞和降落会活5分钟前，每个事件。

sentences.english: We strongly recommend that you now take a moment to read this safety card before take-off.
sentences.chinese: 我们强烈建议您花几分钟时间在起飞前阅读安全卡片。

sentences.english: Ifthe threat is from the side, the fly leans the other way before takeoff.
sentences.chinese: 借使威胁来自这边，苍蝇起飞前会倾向另一侧。

sentences.english: The check list(checklist) is similar to what airplane pilots use before takeoffs set(and) landings.
sentences.chinese: 清单类似于飞机飞行员在起飞和着陆前做什么。

sentences.english: This amazing bionic bird can take-off, fly, and land autonomously.
sentences.chinese: 这种智能鸟可以自动起飞，飞行以及降落。

sentences.english: I'd like to confirm the departure time.
The plane was hijacked soon after it took off.
sentences.chinese: 该机起飞不久便遭劫持。

sentences.english: Certainly. Miss Reed. What is the flight number and date of departure, please?
sentences.chinese: 好的，瑞德女士。请问航班号和起飞日期？

sentences.english: The plane was heavily damaged in crash on take-off.
sentences.chinese: 飞机在起飞时坠落，遭到严重损坏。

sentences.english: When a plane begins to take off or land, its passengers should fasten their seat belt, too.
sentences.chinese: 当飞机开始起飞或降落的时候，乘客也应系好安全带。

sentences.english: I do so, father, and I send him my Soul with it!
sentences.chinese: 我要飞吻，父亲，我把灵魂也一起飞给他。

sentences.english: Special meal should be booked 24 hours before departure.
sentences.chinese: 特殊餐食应在飞机起飞前24小时定妥。

sentences.english: What are the departure times of flights on Saturdays from Beijing to San Francisc?
sentences.chinese: 周六北京飞往旧金山的班机几点起飞？

sentences.english: See you tomorrow then. What time is your flight?
sentences.chinese: 那么明天见。你的航班什么时候起飞？

definition: to return to the point of departure
to rise to the sky/to lift off/to levitate/liftoff
(of aircraft) to take off and land
scheduled flight/flight number/plane/scheduled sailing/sailing number/passenger ship
opportunity in a battle/fighter aircraft/war secret
